post_text:
The original housekeeping post has been removed and we have edited for clarity here. Sorry for the miscommunication and not being clear the first time!

A little bit of housekeeping:

We are not allowing visitors on campuses.

We are not allowing food deliveries.

If you need to pick up your child for a doctor's appointment, please self-screen and ensure they have a doctor's note upon returning. If you are taking your child out for a reason other than a doctor's appointment, they cannot return that day.

We are continuously cleaning and sanitizing all high traffic areas. We aren't using water fountains - but have refill stations for clear water fountains. Sanitation stations have been placed throughout buildings. We are social distancing where possible. Masks or face shields are required for kindergarten through 12th grade and all staff.

These are all to help slow the spread of all illnesses. These are not set in stone for the entire school year. These will be evaluated regularly.

Thank you for bearing with us during this time.

As a reminder, you are allowed to change from Virtual to Face-to-Face and vice versa, but it can only be done at the six-week mark.

Contact your campus to let them know you would like to switch.

THE SWITCH WILL BECOME EFFECTIVE ON SEPTEMBER 28th (first day of new six weeks).

You cannot change in the middle of the six weeks.

Hillsboro Junior High School
August 25 at 7:41 AM ¬∑

Hillsboro JH will have it‚Äôs final Chromebook distribution day today from 12-4 for all face-to-face and virtual learners. We have papers that MUST be signed by parent/guardian AND student whether or not you are getting a Chromebook. Instruction will begin tomorrow using the Chromebooks and students will NEED to be online to be counted present and also to get credit for the days work. An orientation for all virtual learners also MUST be held prior to instruction beginning tomorrow. Students will not receive Chromebooks without parent/guardian and student signatures as well. Please come take care of this important step today prior to tomorrow‚Äôs first day of school. We will be distributing from 12-4.

Electronic registration will close today! If registration was not completed by August 17th, we are looking forward to seeing your child face to face. If you would like to go virtual, you need to contact a campus administrator.

You may change your preference of instruction (face-to-face or virtual) one time between August 26th-September 9th. If you choose to change after that date, you must wait until the grading period ends.

There will be no fans allowed for these two scrimmages only. The rest of the events will be electronically ticketed ONLY to allow us to cap at 50% of fans.

We are so excited that sports are starting up again! This week, we're having a couple of volleyball scrimmages.

There will be no fans allowed for these two scrimmages only. The rest of the events will be electronically ticketed ONLY to allow us to cap at 50% of fans.

post_text: Safety and learning go hand in hand - and we understand that. In order to create a safe space to learn, don't forget about some new policies we've implemented to make sure that we are reducing the spread of COVID-19.
text: Safety and learning go hand in hand - and we understand that. In order to create a safe space to learn, don't forget about some new policies we've implemented to make sure that we are reducing the spread of COVID-19.

post_text:
Hillsboro High School will be having a come and go 2 hour Return to School and Device Pickup!

GIRLS, please enter through the front of the academic building
BOYS, please enter in the back of the academic building and proceed to the library

WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 19TH
Freshmen - 9 a.m.
Sophomores - 1 p.m.

THURSDAY, AUGUST 20TH
Juniors - 9 a.m.
Seniors - 1 p.m.

Device Pick Up: It is a 2 hour window. Students will get their chromebook, attend a short orientation class, and then they are free to leave. Those that are here at 9am will go first, and then the others will go as they arrive.

Parents will need to complete The BRIDGE Program Chromebook User Agreement - online in Google Forms. Here is the link: https://forms.gle/W1VgRQ1oLdFQ3rrP8

Students will need to bring a $25 deposit with them in order to pick up their chromebook - cash or check only.
text:
Hillsboro High School will be having a come and go 2 hour Return to School and Device Pickup!

GIRLS, please enter through the front of the academic building
BOYS, please enter in the back of the academic building and proceed to the library

WEDNESDAY, AUGUST 19TH
Freshmen - 9 a.m.
Sophomores - 1 p.m.

THURSDAY, AUGUST 20TH
Juniors - 9 a.m.
Seniors - 1 p.m.

Device Pick Up: It is a 2 hour window. Students will get their chromebook, attend a short orientation class, and then they are free to leave. Those that are here at 9am will go first, and then the others will go as they arrive.

Parents will need to complete The BRIDGE Program Chromebook User Agreement - online in Google Forms. Here is the link: https://forms.gle/W1VgRQ1oLdFQ3rrP8

Students will need to bring a $25 deposit with them in order to pick up their chromebook - cash or check only.

You will use your Chromebook to register for your Hill College classes with an advisor Thursday, August 6 from 9-12 or 1-4.

You will NOT be enrolled if you do not come this day.

Hill College starts Mon, Aug 24th.
Hillsboro High School starts Wed, Aug 26th.

Registration is next week!

For health and safety precautions, please only one adult and/or the student you're registering. Please wear a mask.

You will need: social security card, birth certificate, current shot record, proof of residency (utility bill, lease agreement, etc), driver's license of parent/guardian enrolling student, and transcript or report card from previous school, if needed.

You can find the registration packet here: https://buff.ly/3hr06gq. We will have copies available on campus, but if you would like to expedite the process, print and fill out the packet beforehand.

post_text:
For the 2020-2021 school year, here are the options for learning in the fall.

When registering, you will choose face-to-face or virtual learning. Virtual Learning will NOT look like it did in the spring. This choice can be reevaluated every six weeks. Those who virtual learn will not be able to participate in extracurricular activities.

Please note that these plans could change depending on state guidelines.

Edited to add: for Face-to-Face learning, students will be required to follow state and safety guidelines.

post_text:
Hillsboro ISD has tentatively moved the first day of school to Wednesday, August 26th (must be approved by the Board of Trustees on July 27th). This allows us to:
- Prepare for different learning models
- Have time to provide staff development and train teachers

Our motto is ‚ÄòPreparing today‚Äôs students for tomorrow‚Äôs world‚Äô and to do so we must prepare our teachers first.

We want to see each and every student face to face. However, we are offering a virtual learning option. This WILL NOT look like it did in the spring. This option will require a higher level of rigor, workload, and time commitment from the virtual learning that occurred in the spring of 2020.

If you have any questions, please feel free to send us a Facebook message or email webmaster@hillsboroisd.org.

post_text:
Uh oh! It looks like our post from Tuesday didn't post! Here's a recap of what we are starting - a couple of days later.

In the parent survey results, a lot of you said that technology was hard for your family because understanding it isn't always the easiest. Every Tuesday, we will be posting tips, tricks, and what HISD uses to help bridge the gap.

Today, we want to share Securly with you! HISD uses this for all school devices as a way to have full visibility into students' online activity while monitoring for signs of cyberbullying, suicide, and violence.

Please visit securely . com/securly-home (make sure to delete the spaces!) to learn how to utilize this software at home. There is a video that we highly recommend watching if you're interested.

post_text:
FREE ST MATH INFORMATION

HISD is happy to announce that ST Math will be available to our families for FREE this summer. ST Math is a digital math program and learning games for students in grades PK to 8th Grade. We encourage you to take advantage of this learning opportunity.

Signing up is easy! Parents will need about 5 minutes and the following to set up the account.
- Access to an internet-connected device
- A working email address that can be accessed during the setup process

Please watch this short video to walk-through the sign-up process.
How to Get Started with FREE ST MATH: https://buff.ly/2Nauazz

For additional Information or for set-up assistance, please contact:
1-888-491-6603 (Mon-Fri, 8am-7pm)
support@mindresearch.org

Visit the ST MATH Parent Site here: https://buff.ly/2Bf7pI5

post_text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.
P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: https://buff.ly/3gGdTjz
text:
Pandemic Electronic Benefit Transfer (P-EBT) is a one-time food benefit for families who lost access to free or reduced-price meals due to school closures. Eligible P-EBT families will receive application instructions from schools in late May. The P-EBT application will open the first week of June.
P-EBT food benefits are for children who received SNAP food benefits for March 2020 and children who are certified for free or reduced-price school meals during the 2019-20 Texas school year. For more information, visit: https://buff.ly/3gGdTjz

In honor of our Class of 2020, today's #FlashbackFriday comes from the Class of 1972.

Seniors, we know today was supposed to be your graduation day at the Ferrell Center. Things haven't worked out that way, but we are proud of you and your ability to roll with the punches. We can't wait to celebrate you on June 12th!

Franklin Eagles
May 22 at 8:10 AM ¬∑

Enrollment packets for the 20-21 school year are now available online on the HISD main page and on the FES page if you would like to download them. We will also make them available in front of FES on May 26, 27, 27 and June 1, 2, 3 from 8:00 AM - 2:00 PM. You can swing by and grab a packet if that is easier for you.
Please bring completed paperwork to the PK Round-Up because it will speed up the registration process.

PK Round -Up will be June 29-30 from 9:00 AM to 3:00 PM.

If you have HISD technology and you are a current Franklin student, please turn that in to Franklin next week.

If you were unable to pick up your student items over the past 3 days, please contact your teacher and schedule a time to pick those items up.

shared_text:
Hillsboro Junior High School
May 14 at 3:14 PM ¬∑

Letters have been mailed out, but we wanted to let our 8th grade parents know that Pre-Enrollment/Planning Conferences will be taking place at Hillsboro High School, on Wednesday May 20th from 1-5. Each 8th grade student will have a 15 minute appointment with an advisor to discuss the student‚Äôs plan for the four years in high school, and what he/she plans to do for at least two years after high school graduation. Every student and parent/guardian must meet with an advisor to develop a personal graduation plan.

We will be taking all social distancing precautions to make sure that everyone is spread out and safe during this process.

All parents/guardians have to approve of their student‚Äôs plan for a 9th grade schedule to be processed, so if you are not to attend on Wednesday, a conference will be scheduled for a later date.

FES Announcements:
1. Yearbooks won't be delivered until Mid-June -we will come up with a plan for getting them to you when they arrive.
2. Please come to FES next week - Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday (5/18, 5/19, 5/20) - from 9-11 AM- to pick up student items (blankets, mats, refunds, etc.) Pull up to the front with your pick-up tag in the window, and will will bring your items out.
3. PK round-up for the 2020-2021 school year has not been scheduled yet. Will keep you posted!
We miss you - stay safe!

post_text: Don't forget about the District-Wide Elementary Parade today!
shared_text:
Hillsboro Intermediate School
May 4 at 9:02 PM ¬∑

HIS Families...don't forget about our District Wide Elementary Parade is tomorrow! Our parade will start at 10am and we hope to see you along the route. We are sorry we can't come to each of your houses, but hope you find a location we are visiting so we can see your smiling faces! We miss you ALL so much!

Please remember to stay out of the streets as we drive by and do not try to join our parade line. We want to keep you all safe!

As a special treat Pokey O's food truck will be in the HES parking lot from 12:30-2pm for the public to come and enjoy a sweet treat!
#HISchooseslove #HillsboroISDPride

post_text:
Today is School Lunch Hero Day and let me tell you, our food service family is the best out there!

This team has adapted over these past few weeks to make sure that lunches are prepared for pick up and they even hop on the buses to deliver meals themselves. They get to work before all of us to make sure that everyone is fed. Stewart, the Director of Dining Services, Coaches Hale and Bodeker, and our bus drivers have coordinated with our food service team during this time as well. We love you guys! #HillsboroISDPride

shared_text:
YOUTUBE.COM
Courage of Famous Failures - Inspirational

Hillsboro Junior High School
April 29 at 2:53 PM ¬∑

To my 8th graders who are frustrated for missing out on certain opportunities or for not being perfect....Ms. Hawkins reminds you:
1. Let failure make you, not break you
2. Use disappointment as fuel to grow
3. Sometimes we want an opportunity and hate to not get it, but something better comes along
4. You ARE enough. Keep grinding. And watch this 5 minute video of people who I bet you never knew struggled to get where they are!!

post_text: We've got a couple of faves in here! What are your favorite quotes?
shared_text:
Hillsboro Junior High School
April 21 at 5:15 PM ¬∑

I am very proud of my 8th grade reading students for the time they invested in their writing assignment this past week. They filled in a 5 slide Google doc about quotes. They picked a quote that means something to them. They stated the author, why the quote was significant and important to their life, and illustrated how it is exhibited through choosing symbols and pictures as representations. I was inspired and enlightened by what some of them chose. It was one more instance where I felt like their authentic work showed me another piece of who they are. I pasted about 20 of their chosen quotes onto a doc to share with you all.
Keep up the good work, my smarties!! Ms. Hawkins is paying attention to your continued efforts "in the classroom"!

shared_text:
Hillsboro Intermediate School
April 14 at 10:33 PM ¬∑

HIS FAMILIES....We are excited to share that The Jesse Lewis Choose Love Movement has partnered with the Santoro Foundation, and the School Mental Health Collaborative at University of South Florida, to launch a 90-day initiative to promote the positive impact of Social and Emotional Learning (#SEL) skills and tools on mood, relationships and productivity during the COVID-19 pandemic.

The FREE ChooSELove To Thrive program will consist of easy and actionable daily tips for the whole family based on the Choose Love Formula from Jesse Lewis Choose Love Movement, designed to uplift and inspire us all to respond to the uncertainty of this time and the future with love based on scientifically-proven SEL principles. Please take the time to join! It will be well worth your time! #HISchooseslove #HillsboroISDPride

To learn more and subscribe, visit: www.ChooSELoveToThrive.org
Or text SEL to 484848

post_text: This week is National Assistant Principal Week! We want to take dedicated today's #ThankfulTuesday to all of our incredible APs throughout the district. We may be a bit biased, but we definitely have the best ones! APs, your hard work and dedication does not go unnoticed. We appreciate you and all the blood, sweat, and tears you put in to make our schools better.

Today, Mr. Cummings wants to shout out Omar Trujillo and Jackson Steele. During the first online meeting, the comic relief you both brought to the table made it a little more comfortable for everyone. #HillsboroISDPride

Keep sending us a message with your shout outs and tag these guys and their families to let them know they're doing a great job!

post_text: Common symptoms of #COVID19 are fever, dry cough, & shortness of breath. If you have mild symptoms, call your doctor & #StayHome. If you develop serious symptoms, such as trouble breathing, pressure in the chest, or bluish lips or face, call your doctor & seek care immediately. #HillsboroISDPride

We want to hear your shoutouts!

Has your child's teacher been doing something great? Is there another parent that you see has done something cool? Has your campus leadership been going above and beyond?

We want to bring a little bit of light to the situation and share the great things that are happening in our district. Send us a message with who you'd like to shout out and why (we want to break up the newsfeed!).

shared_text:
Franklin Eagles
March 30 at 11:33 AM ¬∑

Hello Everyone!
Just a little info update from FES!

Our office hours, for the time being, will be 8:00 AM to 2:00 PM. All doors to the building are locked, so please call for an appointment before you come to the building - 254-582-4130.

Also, be on the lookout for information from your teacher regarding future packet pick-up. We are collecting data to find out how many parents can get future packets and information through digital sources - email, social media, etc. Please respond to your teacher as soon as possible. If we can get you all information digitally, we will do that in the future and reduce the time you spend out and about.

That is all for now! Have a wonderful Monday, and please let us know if you need anything at all.

post_text: FES Material Pick-up Information for FRIDAY, MARCH 27
shared_text:
Franklin Eagles
March 24 at 4:47 PM ¬∑

Notes from Mrs. Steele: this message contains information regarding material pick-up for FES.
We will have materials pick-up from 7:30 to 9:30 AM (Friday) here in front of FES -- Chick-fil-A style. Just have your normal pick-up tag in your window. I will call it in on the walkie, and your child's materials bag will be brought to your car. If your child is a bus rider, don't worry. Just roll your window down, give me the info I need, and I will call it in that way. If you can't come during those times, please let your teacher know so that we can work something out. It is very important that you pick these materials up as they are an essential part of the distance learning plan we have designed for your child. We look forward to seeing you soon!
text:
FES Material Pick-up Information for FRIDAY, MARCH 27

Franklin Eagles
March 24 at 4:47 PM ¬∑

Notes from Mrs. Steele: this message contains information regarding material pick-up for FES.
We will have materials pick-up from 7:30 to 9:30 AM (Friday) here in front of FES -- Chick-fil-A style. Just have your normal pick-up tag in your window. I will call it in on the walkie, and your child's materials bag will be brought to your car. If your child is a bus rider, don't worry. Just roll your window down, give me the info I need, and I will call it in that way. If you can't come during those times, please let your teacher know so that we can work something out. It is very important that you pick these materials up as they are an essential part of the distance learning plan we have designed for your child. We look forward to seeing you soon!

Yesterday our teachers and staff made 1631 calls to parents and guardians. 1631!!!

Through this trying time, we are taking a Personal Responsibility In Delivering Excellence. We are #HillsboroISDPRIDE.

If you haven't received a call - or missed a call - from your child's campus, we are continuing calls today. If you haven't received a call by tomorrow, give the campus a call!

We're working through this situation together and we will get through this together.

post_text:
HS Girls Powerlifting are back from Del Valle and they represented the Eagles very well.

The girls brought home 3rd place as a team.
6 girls medaled
Jaedyn Campos 5th
Salma Ramirez 2nd
Bene Martinez 3rd
Shelia Flores 1st
Annette Castaneda 3rd
Kaylee DeVries 3rd

Salma, Bene, Shelia, Annette, & Kaylee all qualified for state and will compete in Waco on March 20.

Shelia Flores also earned Best Heavyweight lifter, Best Squat on the heavyweight platform, Best Bthsench on the heavyweight platform and set the new regional bench press record.

post_text: Thanks to the Running Club for volunteering at the 2020 Cowtown event!
shared_text:
Hillsboro Junior High School
March 1 at 6:58 PM ¬∑

This weekend Running Club volunteered at The 2020 Cowtown of Fort Worth! This event has over 20,000 participants through their weekend races. 6th grade volunteered at the 5k water station on Saturday. 8th Graders put in some serious work at the fluid station for mile 30 of the Ultra & Mile 25 of the Marathon on Sunday. Arriving at 7am for set-up and steadily giving water to runners from 9am-2pm. Being the last water station after hours of running, our kids gave out well over 3,000 cups. I have been on both ends of this event and I will tell you that I have gained a new appreciation for the volunteers. It was a great experience for them to be in a running environment, learn the value of service and bond with their teammates along the way. Proud Coach,
Coach Carmona
text:
Thanks to the Running Club for volunteering at the 2020 Cowtown event!

Hillsboro Junior High School
March 1 at 6:58 PM ¬∑

This weekend Running Club volunteered at The 2020 Cowtown of Fort Worth! This event has over 20,000 participants through their weekend races. 6th grade volunteered at the 5k water station on Saturday. 8th Graders put in some serious work at the fluid station for mile 30 of the Ultra & Mile 25 of the Marathon on Sunday. Arriving at 7am for set-up and steadily giving water to runners from 9am-2pm. Being the last water station after hours of running, our kids gave out well over 3,000 cups. I have been on both ends of this event and I will tell you that I have gained a new appreciation for the volunteers. It was a great experience for them to be in a running environment, learn the value of service and bond with their teammates along the way. Proud Coach,
Coach Carmona

HES PARENTS: Monday, March 2 is Dr. Seuss's birthday and in celebration of that we would like to invite all students and staff to participate in a week of READING FUN! Each day has a theme that corresponds with a well known Dr. Seuss book for you and students to DRESS UP.
Mon - Cat in the Hat
Tues - One Fish Two Fish
Wed - Fox in Socks
Thurs - Oh, the Places You'll Go!
Fri - Wacky Wednesday

shared_text:
Hillsboro Junior High School
February 7 at 1:36 PM ¬∑

FCA starting the day and ending the week with a positive, encouraging word. Thank you Coach Hewitt for being our guest speaker today. Students share their amazing takeaway below.

Today, in FCA Coach Hewitt did a really good teaching over our spiritual bag. I know now that everything that you carry in your bag can affect the way people see in you and how you show yourself to people. Everything you carry in your spiritual bag may feel light but really it's holding you down. The most important thing that I took from this lesson was how Coach Hewitt lived. Its was basically like his testimony to how he gave his life to God. It was powerful.
-8Th Grade FCA Student

Going to FCA in the morning inspires me everyday to look forward in life, to always lean towards God in whatever I do, because in the end he is always there.
-8Th Grade FCA Student

#FCAFridays #HJHSFamily

Rotary Club of Hillsboro
January 16 at 4:15 PM ¬∑

Rotary Club of Hillsboro honored HJHS students Chris Montoya and Juleisse Gonzalez in noon meeting on January 15 at Lone Star Caf√©. Rotary President Cami Steele (R) introduced Counselor Jordyn Russell (L) who presented the students who shared with the club their interests and goals. Both students are academic achievers and active in UIL and athletics. Gonzales plays saxophone and was placed in All-Region Band. Rotary has a long tradition of recognizing student leadership in Hillsboro schools.

Due to the wet field conditions, we will only have 2 games on our field
tonight. There will be no B team games tonight. We know this is an inconvenience and are sorry for the short notice.

All 7th grade players will play with 7A and all 8th grade players will play with 8A.

The 7A game will start at 4:30 and the 8A will start after that game.

post_text: Hillsboro ISD was made aware of the tragic loss of a student from our intermediate campus from an accident this weekend. Limited details will be made public as the district wishes to respect the privacy of the family. The death of a student, however, has a ripple effect on the school community. Therefore, counseling services will be made available. We are asking for prayers for the family, students, and staff.
text: Hillsboro ISD was made aware of the tragic loss of a student from our intermediate campus from an accident this weekend. Limited details will be made public as the district wishes to respect the privacy of the family. The death of a student, however, has a ripple effect on the school community. Therefore, counseling services will be made available. We are asking for prayers for the family, students, and staff.

Heart of Texas North FCA
September 26, 2019 at 3:05 PM ¬∑

Great job today Eagles! ü¶Ö
Their weekly FCA Huddle Meeting at Hillsboro HS today during lunch featured guest speaker, Joe Abreu. He is an HHS Grad (2009) and is a local State Trooper serving Ellis County.

He shared about his career in law enforcement, shared experiences from his time in high school as an FCA member and Eagle athlete, as well as musician.

He shared a great illustration, ‚ÄúThe Nails and The Fence,‚Äù to demonstrate how impactful our words & actions are.

He pointed us to God‚Äôs Word and spoke life into students & staff alike with these scriptures:

Ephesians 4:32
Luke 17:3-4
Psalm 37:1-5
1 Timothy 4:12

Thank you, Officer Abreu, for speaking life into The HHS Eagles today! ü¶Ö
Hillsboro Independent School District
Hillsboro Athletic Booster Club

#FCA #LetsGo
#HillsboroFCA
#HillsboroEagles

Tomorrow we will represent our favorite sports team. Students are allowed to wear baseball caps that represents their favorite team as well.

Thank you so much to the National PTA for the honor and for coming to recognize us, Texas PTA! Our PTA has worked so hard and it shows.
shared_text:
Texas PTA
September 19, 2019 at 3:07 PM ¬∑

Texas PTA Executive Director Kyle Ward returned to his first-grade campus today in Hillsboro, the birthplace of Texas PTA. Kyle celebrated Franklin Elementary in Hillsboro Independent School District as a National PTA School of Excellence.

"Texas PTA founder Ella Caruthers Porter would be so proud of this campus. How great it was to go home where my public education began!" - Kyle

shared_text:
Mrs. Abreu's Art Class
August 27, 2019 at 4:24 PM ¬∑

3rd - 5th Graders made Notans

A notan is a Japanese design concept of placing light and dark next to each other to create harmony. We learned about positive and negative space and we drew organic and geometric shapes. Then we cut and paste the shapes to create a collage.
